resources.string: Do you see 2 different colors (shades)\nin this image?

The test will help you determine how well you distinguish between shades of colors.\n\nThis test is a modified version of Diana Derval\'s test adapted for mobile devices. Go to www.dervalresearch.com to learn more.
Poor color discrimination. You probably prefer black, beige and blue clothes.\nAbout 25\% of people fall into this category.
Average color discrimination. You can see many shades of purple/blue, green and red.\nAbout 50\% of people fall into this category.

Good color discrimination! You can see many shades of purple/blue, green, red and yellow. Most likely you are irritated by yellow and do not wear clothes of this color.\nAbout 25\% of people fall into this category.
This test will help determine if you have nearsightedness or farsightedness.

Attention!\nThe test is performed in turn for both eyes. First, cover one eye with your hand and look at the image. Then repeat this for the other eye. Answer the corresponding questions at the end of the test.
Close one eye and look at the image. Then close the other eye and repeat the actions.
What did you see in the image?
Characters on a red background were clearer
Characters on a green background were clearer
Characters on both backgrounds were equally clear
Attention! Vision problems have been detected. See an ophthalmologist for a professional vision test.
This test will help you evaluate how well you can distinguish low-contrast areas of an image.\nFor better accuracy of the test, it is advisable to hold the smartphone at arm\'s length.

Attention! The accuracy of the test depends significantly on the quality of your device\'s screen. If it has low brightness/color rendering, then you may not pass the final stages of the test, even with perfect vision.
Click on the arrow in the direction in which the circle has a cutout
Good result!\nThe lower the minimum discernible contrast, the better.
Perfect result!\nIt is impossible to distinguish a contrast of 0\% - then there would be no difference between the image and the background.
This test will help identify if you have different types of color vision abnormalities.\nThe well-known tables of prof. Rabkin E.B. are used in this test.
Attention! The accuracy of the test depends significantly on the quality of your device\'s screen. If it has low brightness/color rendering, this may introduce inaccuracy into the test results.
What do you see in the image?
This test is designed to evaluate your visual acuity. Everyone usually undergoes such a check when visiting an ophthalmologist.\n\nTo pass the test correctly, hold your smartphone at arm\'s length.
Attention! Before taking the test, be sure to calibrate the image scale in the application settings, and also enter the length of your arm.

1. Before taking the test, be sure to calibrate the image scale in the application settings, and also enter the length of your arm.

2. Remove glasses/lenses if you have them.

3. Carefully read on the screen which eye you need to close and carefully close it with your free hand. Do not put pressure on your eye with your hand.

4. Hold your smartphone at arm's length and click on the "Start" button.

5. A symbol will appear on the screen. You need to try to recognize it and remember it. When you're ready, click the "Reply" button.

6. Select the symbol seen on the previous screen and click on the “Continue” button. If you couldn't see the symbol, select the "Can't answer" option.

7. Repeat the previous steps until the test is completed.

8. You can select the character set as well as the eye to be tested on the previous test description screen.
Close carefully with your hand\nleft eye
Close carefully with your hand\nright eye
Move your smartphone to arm\'s length and press the button
Are you sure you want to interrupt the test? Current progress will be lost.
Select what part of your active period it is. For most people, this is morning, afternoon or evening, respectively.
Or set up automatic selection on a schedule
This test will help determine if you have astigmatism.

Attention!\nDuring the test, hold the phone at arm\'s length.\nThe test is performed in turn for both eyes. First, cover one eye with your hand and look at the image. Then repeat this for the other eye. Answer the corresponding questions at the end of the test.
The rays begin to merge exactly half their length; the distortion border is perfectly round
The image merges into a solid gray mass
The rays blur, intersect or turn negative; the distortion border is different from circular

the set value for the length of your arm. Measure your arm length and then enter it by clicking the button below. Alternatively, you can enter your height, then the arm length will be calculated from it using the formula.
Enter your arm length in centimeters
Measure the red line below with a ruler and enter the result. Current value
Enter the red line\'s length in centimeters
Are you sure you want to delete this entry from the journal?
ATTENTION! All test results will be deleted from the journal. Are you sure you want to continue?
Journal was successfully exported to the folder:
Availability of data in the folder
Duplicates in the journal were successfully deleted
Problems with vision have been noticed.
The average visual acuity is %.2f for the left eye and %.2f for the right.
Your visual acuity for %d %s has changed by %+.1f%% for the left eye and by %+.1f%% for the right.
The difference in visual acuity between eyes is %.2f.
Enter the results of your visual acuity test by the doctor
Enter results for at least one eye
The test result is very similar to an error, it is recommended to try the test again

This application is an open source project written by one person for free. You can write about all problems and wishes to the email specified in the settings in the \"About app\" section. There you will also find a link to the source code repository.

2.2.1
• Added the ability to change the application language from system settings (Android 13+).

2.2.0
• Dark theme added. You can choose dark/light theme from the main screen settings tab.
• Bug fixes.

2.1.1
• Bug fixes.

2.1.0
• Optimization for Android 14.
• Redesign and UI improvements.
• Color perception test improved.
• Bug fixes.
• Improvement of texts.
No backup found in the selected folder
This application is an open source project written by one person for free. You can write about all problems and wishes by email. Below is a link to the source code repository.
To analyze statistical data, it is necessary to take at least 10 measurements of visual acuity. These measurements should be made over a period of 6 to 90 days.
